main_description: I am a multimedia journalist based in New York. I have focused my work on exploring the relationship between journalism and technology, always seeking new narratives and formats to tell a story.
about_me:
I am currently coursing my master's degree in Social Journalism with a scholarship from the City University of New York and I was one of the scholarships winners in 2021 by the Association of Foreign Press Correspondents in the United States.

Currently, I work as a Sub-Editor in Spanish for the Global Investigative Journalism Network (GIJN), where I am in charge of promoting investigative and data journalism in the region and generating and disseminating growth opportunities for Spanish-speaking journalists. I also belong to the digital team of La Tercera, Chilean news outlet, where I seek the development of new products and the improvement of existing ones and grow the subscriber program, in addition to collaborating as a reporter. During the last years I have published health and migration topics in Efecto Cocuyo, Cinco 8, Distintas Latitudes, Caracas Chronicles, La Tercera and Salud con Lupa
newsletter_description: My personal project is a newsletter where I recommend articles and journalistic tools, share readings and tell a little about living in New York. I send it every two weeks and you can subscribe here.
